Understate: The claim understates the potential of embryonic stem cell research by stating that "the greater possibilities, the real science movement, has been with adult stem cell research."
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that adult stem cell research is superior to embryonic stem cell research.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the opinions of scientists universally support adult stem cell research over embryonic stem cell research, which may not be the case.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or acknowledge that both types of stem cell research have their own advantages and disadvantages.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that embryonic stem cells have the potential to become all cell types of the body, while adult stem cells are limited to differentiating into different cell types of their tissue of origin.
